defs: the earth.
the first of the seven worlds.
(phil.) the earth as one of the five basic elements, representing grossness of the physical objects including the bodies of living beings.
(pros.) a meter consisting of three long syllablic instants (---); molassus.
the hissing sound of a snake.
the science dealing with the nature and origin of the earth's topographic features including those under the sea; geomorphology.
pertaining to the heat of the earth's interior; geothermic.
a tax levied on land (as agricultural, building sites, etc.).
a shaking or trembling of the crust of the earth, caused by underground volcanic forces or by breaking and shifting of rock beneath the surface; earth-quake.
(fig.) a sudden explosion or outburst of one's wrath.
= ಭೂಕಂಪ.
a kind of plant.
the ruler of a state; a king.
any of the six or seven great divisions of land on the globe (as Asia, Africa, Australia, Europe, North and South America, Europe, and sometimes, Antarctica); a continent.
a species of palm.
being or existing, occurring, working, placed, used, etc. beneath the surface of the earth; underground.
secret; hidden; undercover.
that which is or is existing, occurring, working, placed, used, etc. beneath the surface of the earth; underground.
the condition of being completely demolished, raised to the ground.
the interior of the earth.
water seeped into, available under the surface of the earth; underground water.

the science that deals with the dynamics and physical history and nature of the earth, formation and composition of the rocks, and the physical, chemical, and biological changes that the earth has undergone or is undergoing; geology.
(masc.) a specialist in geology; a geologist.
(fem.) a specialist in geology; a geologist.
a kind of balsam tree (?).
= ಭೂಗುಗ್ಗಳ.
the physical features of a nation or part of the nation.
quality of the soil (particularly with reference to its use in agriculture.
a room or group of rooms below the ground level and usu. under a building; cellar floor of a building.
the inhabitant of the earth, chiefly the human beings.
= ಭೂಗೋಳ.
= ಭೂಗೋಳಶಾಸ್ತ್ರ.
the earth of geoid shape.
the earth viewed as a hypothetical ellipsoid with the surface represented as a mean sea level; the geoid.

the descriptive science dealing with the surface of the earth, its division into continents and countries, and the climate, plants, animals, natural resources, inhabitants, and industries of the various divisions; geography.
a man who has studied and well versed in geography; a man who has specialised in geographical research, delineation and study; a geographer.
a woman who has studied and well versed in geography; a woman who has specialised in geographical research, delineation and study; a geographer.
the entire earth.
the vine Convolvulus arvensis of Convolvulaceae family.
an emperor who rules the entire or most part of the, earth.
the act of living, moving on land.
an animal living on land (rather than in water, in the air, in trees, etc.).
(in part.) a human being or human being collectively.
the fact of living, moving on land.
a mystical power that helps to move freely anywhere on land.
the plant Ipomoea digitata of Convolvulaceae family.
its starchy tuberous root.
darkness; lack of light.
the shadow of the earth.
Rāhu, the mythological serpent demon and one of the nine astrological planets.
a man who cuts or digs the land surface (for making roads).
the tree Butea bojapatra of Papilionaceae family, the smooth bark of which can easily be peeled off in thin sheets; a birch tree.
anything that is born in or from the earth (as a plant); (gen.) a tree.
a kind of snail or snail-shell(?) .
a kind of plant .
the attitude of not being prepared for facing a danger beforehand.
Sīte, the daughter of the earth and the heroine in the epic Rāmāyaṇa.
the ruler of the land; a king.
gone; past.
actually happened; true; real.
proper; appropriate.
consisted of; mixed, associated with.
similar; equal; like.
something that actually exists or existed; reality; truth; fact.
that which took place, happened or was.
a thing that has been got, obtained or received.
Śiva.
a class of attendants of Śiva.
any of or collectively all, the living beings.
the disembodied soul of a dead person, supposed to be wandering and haunt human being; a ghost.
(esp.) such a soul of a person who died in fire.
the phenomenal world.
a class of demi-gods.
that which is gone, slipped or past.
any of the nine astrological planets.
an elderly and respectable man.
(phil.) any of the five basic elements which constitute all the physical matter in the phenomenal world.
(adj.) the quality or fact of being of extraordinary or unusual size.
(math.) a symbol for the number five.
(gram.) the past tense.
ಭೂತ ಮೆಟ್ಟುಕೊಳ್ಳು bhūta meṭṭikoḷḷu = ಭೂತ ಹಿಡಿ; ಭೂತ ಹಿಡಿ bhūta hiḍi (an evil spirit) to possess a person.
a small-sized tree or shrub Helieteres isora of Sterculiaceae family, with fibrous bark.
the time, period of time that is past or spent.
(gram.) the past tense.
the verb with terminations suitable for past tense.
the plant Nardostachys jatamansi, of Valerianaceae family, that yields a fragrant ointment used in ancient times; spikenard.
the tree Elaeodendron glaucum of Celestraceae family.
(dial.) worshipping or propitiation of a daemon or a heathen god.
(dial.) a ceremony and a dance connected with this worship.
a multitude of daemons or ghosts.
a class of demigods who attend Śiva.

(pros.) the sign for a long syllable (-).
a concave mirror that magnifies the images of objects.
(loosely) a lens that makes an object look much bigger than actually it is, when seen through it; a magnifying glass.
a lens that makes an object look much bigger than actual it is, when seen through it; a magnifying glass.
(phil.) collectively the four basic elements the earth, water, fire and air believed to constitute all physical matter.
the act or process of driving an evil spirit out or away by incantations and other rituals; exorcism.
the annoyance esp. frequent one, caused by an evil spirit.

compassion towards all the living beings.
any living being having a physical body made of the five basic elements.
the earth.
the lord of a class of demigods or all living beings; Śiva.
(gram.) a participle used to express an action completed before the main action in a sentence; a past participle.
(phil.) collectively the five basic elements the earth, water, fire, air and space (ether) believed to constitute all physical matter.

an archaic monetary coin (equal to one rupee).
the accumalated merits of one's past deeds, esp. the ones committed in the previous births.
a man having such an accumulation.
(dial.) worshipping or propitiation of a daemon or demi-god.
worshipping or propitiation of the basic elements of nature.
an offering made to propitiate a demon or demigod.

an offering made to all the living beings, one of the five sacrifices that a householder has to observe daily.
the form of a verb with appropriate terminations to depict the action in past tense.

the wanton play or action of an evil spirit, as annoying, haunting the people.
a senseless, unprovoked, unjustifiable or deliberately malicious action.

(phil.) a person who advocates that the soul is nothing but the conbination of the earth, water, fire and air.

the tree Vitex negundo of Verbenaceae family.
its white flower.
an irrational, excessive fear supposed to have been or imagined to have been caused by an evil spirit.
a ritual performed to remove evil spirits before any auspicious action as worship.
the state of evil spirits, demi-gods, etc. being satisfied (with the propiation).

a kind of yogic accomplishment with which one is supposed to have the five basic elements at one's command.
a place where a demi-god or demi-gods are propriated.
welfare of all the living beings, in general.
the surface of the earth.
the earth.
collectively, all the people.
a kind of plant.
collirium applied to the palm of the right hand which would enable the person to see the invisible spirits.
a huge, gigantic form or size.
Śiva.
(pros.) a metre having four letters the first two of which are long, the rest being short ones.
that which is made of the five basic elements (the earth, fire, air, water and space).
the Supreme Being who is present in all living beings.
Śiva.
Viṣṇu.
the individual soul.
he who tortures, troubles the living beings.
(jain.) a class of demi-gods.
the earth, personified and regarded as mother; the earth-mother.
the large-sized, evergreen tree Hydnocarpus laurifolia ( = H. wightiana) of Flacourtiaceae family, the seeds of which yield oil, which is used in treating skin diseases and also for lamps.

the body, as the abode of the soul.
